3 April, 1909.

la

Dr. King Yin Kuat,

Tlantai, China 
My dear Dr. Kwan: -
I enclose herewith a report of your hoy's work for the past ter I 
is e piensure te d ank the excellent spirit and generally gond torulta valet

have characterized your son's efforts here in Andove, da i hans Fitten you

before, we have taken a good deal od pride in the line records made by ty jar 
ity of the Chinese boys who have come to us in recent year, ark all agreed, 
however, that your boy is one of the most satisfantory nembers of the Andover 
Chinese delegation. He has tine natural ability, his spirit na aaye teen 
nost somendable, hie iaithfulness and effort above reproach, and he has always 
conducted himself with that inherent courtesy and reserve that mark the trie 
gentleman. Pereonally I feel that the presne of a key of this charseter in 
aur udást is in itself a strong and helpful influence on our American boya, who 
in the min lack the courtesy and deforente se oharacteristie of the older na 
tione of the Basta que instructors are all exceedingly fond of Sun Sing, and 
are disposed to predict for him a auteeseful and influential career.

trusting that you my teel that the boy's work aná progress here are all 
that could be destres, believe me, wat dina personed regards

Very sincerely yours

Principal
raw: 3 April, 1909. la Dr. King Yin Kuat, Tlantai, China My dear Dr. Kwan:I enclose herewith a report of your hoy's work for the past ter I is e piensure te d ank the excellent spirit and generally gond torulta valet have characterized your son's efforts here in Andove, da i hans Fitten you before, we have taken a good deal od pride in the line records made by ty jar ity of the Chinese boys who have come to us in recent year, ark all agreed, however, that your boy is one of the most satisfantory nembers of the Andover Chinese delegation. He has tine natural ability, his spirit na aaye teen nost somendable, hie iaithfulness and effort above reproach, and he has always conducted himself with that inherent courtesy and reserve that mark the trie gentleman. Pereonally I feel that the presne of a key of this charseter in aur udást is in itself a strong and helpful influence on our American boya, who in the min lack the courtesy and deforente se oharacteristie of the older na tione of the Basta que instructors are all exceedingly fond of Sun Sing, and are disposed to predict for him a auteeseful and influential career. trusting that you my teel that the boy's work aná progress here are all that could be destres, believe me, wat dina personed regards Very sincerely yours Principal

metadata.name: Phillips Academy
metadata.abstract: Letter enclosing a report on Sung Sing's school work. He commends his son for excellent work, fine natural ability, faithfulness and effort, and the courtesy of a true gentleman. Stearns states that the Chinese students have a strong positive influence on their American counterparts.
metadata.collection: Head of School (Stearns) correspondence with Chinese alumni
